First, we need to understand that there are certain qualifications that a person must meet in order to run for President of the United States. These qualifications are laid out in Article II, Section 1 of the United States Constitution. One of these qualifications is that the person must be a natural-born citizen of the United States.

Arnold Schwarzenegger was not born in the United States, but rather in Austria. Therefore, under this qualification, he would be unable to run for President of the United States. This is why the answer to the question is (A) - yes, he would be unable to run for President of the US.

The US Constitution states that a person must be a natural-born citizen of the US in order to run for President. 

Arnold Schwarzenegger was born in Austria and became a naturalized US citizen in 1983. 

Therefore, because Schwarzenegger was not a natural-born citizen of the US, he would be unable to run for President of the US. 

Therefore, the answer is (A) yes, he would be unable to run for President.

While he has been a US resident for many years and is over the age of 35, the crucial qualification here is being a natural-born citizen.

Hence, the correct answer is (A) yes.
